definition: to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy

sentences.english: I am looking for a 4 - by 6 -foot Oriental rug for my reception room.
sentences.chinese: 我在爲我的接待室尋找一塊四呎寬六呎長的東方地毯。

sentences.english: The lobby was large and had been recently redecorated.
sentences.chinese: 旅館裏的接待室很大，而且新近重新裝飾過。

sentences.english: Notarbartolo sits down across from me at one of the visiting room's two dozen small rectangular tables.
sentences.chinese: N坐在接待室的24個小方桌子中的一個前。

sentences.english: From the reception area, I could see the test room through the glass partition.
sentences.chinese: 通過接待室的玻璃隔牆，我可以看見考試的房間。

sentences.english: It was the antechamber of the galleys.
sentences.chinese: 這裏是大橈船的接待室。

sentences.english: Shared space is located on either side of the concourse, near to the nursery and the multi-reception area.
sentences.chinese: 共享空間在廣場的兩側，臨近保育室和多重接待室。

sentences.english: How long have you been waiting in this waiting-room?
sentences.chinese: 你在這接待室裏等了多久了？

sentences.english: You have some guests in the reception room.
sentences.chinese: 有幾位客人在接待室等你。

sentences.english: Reception's floor tile is made from cork.
sentences.chinese: 接待室的地面磚爲軟木材料質地。

definition: compartment (of train, ship etc)/private room at restaurant/rented room for karaoke/hotel room rented by the hour
